Feed Your Family With Javascript
An introduction to JS for Object Oriented Programmers

JS vs C

The central difference between Javascript and C based langues is that JS is interpreted rather than compiled. As a result JS variable types are determined at run time and functions can be treated like any other object.

Because functions are "first class objects," the scope of the this keyword varries widely depending on mode and syntax, and is more complicated to anticipate

A final difference is truthiness. Because javascript isn't compiled to binary, truthiness in the language is a little more arbitrary and illogical

Variables

There are three ways declare a variable in javascript. All three can be used for any variable type.

  1. var

    The most basic form of variable declaration. Fully backwards compatable. Global or function scope

  2. let

    Introduced in ECMAScript 2015 (ES 2015). Block scope, similar to C++ variables

  3. const

    Introduced in ES 2015, similar to let but cannot be reasigned

This

To fully understand JS this, we are going to open up a fully vanilla html page without any pre-compilers
